502230.reference:
Reference  : Muwatta Malik 502230
In-book reference  : Book 4, Hadith 230
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 4, Hadith 230
502230.text: Yahya related to me from Malik from Ibn Shihab from Abu Salama ibn Abdar-Rahman ibn Awf from Abu Hurayra that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "When you stand in prayer, Shaytan comes to you and confuses you until you do not know how much you have prayed. If you find that happening do two sajdas from the sitting position."

502240.reference:
Reference  : Muwatta Malik 502240
In-book reference  : Book 4, Hadith 240
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 4, Hadith 240
502240.text: Yahya related to me from Malik that he had heard that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said, "I forget or I am made to forget so that I may establish the sunna."

502250.reference:
Reference  : Muwatta Malik 502250
In-book reference  : Book 4, Hadith 250
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 4, Hadith 250
502250.text: Yahya related to me from Malik that he had heard that a man questioned al-Qasim ibn Muhammad saying, "My imagination works in the prayer, and it happens to me a lot." Al-Qasim ibn Muhammad said, "Go on with your prayer, for it will not go away from you until you go away saying, 'I have not completed my prayer.' "
